intro: Corunastylis arrecta, commonly known as the erect corunastylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in open habitats. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, and it blooms during the spring and summer months. Corunastylis arrecta is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand saline and arid conditions.
